description: Number of distinct residues of generalized Catalan number 1/((n^2-1)k+1){{n^2 k} choose k} modulo {n^2} as k runs through natural numbers.
references: F. Luca, P. Stanica, "Products of factorials modulo p", manuscript 2001.
links: P. Stanica, p^q Catalan numbers and squarefree binomial coefficients, arXiv:math/0010148 [math.NT], 2000.
formula: For p prime, p != 5, a(p) = p+1.{1/((n^2-1)k+1){{n^2 k} choose {k}} modulo {n^2} | k\in N}
example: a(2)=3 since there are 3 residues of 1/((2^2-1)n+1){{2^2 n} choose {n}} modulo {2^2}, namely {0,1,2}.
author: Pantelimon Stanica (pstanica(AT)mail.aum.edu), Apr 04 2000; corrected Feb 08 2001.
